subject: RE: [junit] Main() never gets called
msgSnippet: Hi, I understand it is not a JUnit problem. But if I use the  task I don t think I can get the JUnit reports generated by Ant. Is there a way to get it?

Hi,
 
I understand it is not a JUnit problem. But if I use the <java> task I don't
think I can get the 
JUnit reports generated by Ant. Is there a way to get it?
I am using main() since I can't find any way to run the same testcases with
with different data.
I have a set of methods in each class which I need to run with different
data. So I am using a
properties files to get the data in the setUp(). I have a set of property
files for each test class
which I loop through to run with different data. Is there any way to do it
without using main()?
 
I looked at the archives also but found some solution which will work if I
had only 1 test method 
to run and pass all the arguments. But I need to run all the methods in 1
class file. 
Please let me know if anyone has a solution.
 
Thanks,
Nusrat
 
 -----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...] 
Sent: Friday, June 25, 2004 8:06 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Main() never gets called



Nusrat Hasan wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> I had faced the same problem but I got a way to do it. You just have to
run
> your tests as Java instead of as JUnit in Eclipse.
> It seems Eclipse doesn't use the main() to run it.
> 
> But I have a similar problem with Ant. I need to run my tests in a loop so
> that I can repeat all the tests in a class
> with different data files. I do it in a loop in the main(). Till now I was
> using Eclipse, so it was fine but now I want to
> use Ant to run the tests so that I can generate reports. Does anybody know
> how to use Ant so that it uses main()
> for the JUnit task.

This isn't a JUnit problem. If you want to invoke main(), then invoke 
it. Use the <java> task.

Everyone: if you write your own main() method, then you're simply 
creating your own application. Run it like any other, whether it's 
running JUnit tests or not.
--
